original: ALMGREN, Arvid Gustaf-Adolf, Civilingenjör, Krångede, f Åtvid, Ögl, 6/11 02 av distr.-veter A K F A o Hilma Ehrling, gm Märta Unger. Studex Lund 21, CTI (V o V) 21—25. Anst h Kreuger & Tolls Byggn.AB 25—32 (bl a ing v Hammarforsens kraftvksbyggn, Årsta-bron, Månsbo kraftvksbyggn o östrands sul-fatfabr:s pumpstnsbyggn), anst Slussbyggn.-ktén Sthlm 32—34, AB Fundament 34—36, (arb.ch v dammbyggn f Storavans regl), Sv Entreprenad AB 36—40 (avd.ing v Kegums kraftvksbyggn i Lettl), anst i Krångede AB sed. 44 ss arb.ch f Krångede o Gammelänge v kraftvksbyggn. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Resor: Polen, Tjeckoslov, Österr, Tyskl 38, Norge 39. Hobbies: Skytte, friluftsliv.
translated: ALMGREN, Arvid Gustaf-Adolf, Civil Engineer, Krångede, born in Åtvid, Ögl, on November 6th, 1902, son of the district veterinarian A K F A and Hilma Ehrling, married to Märta Unger. Studied at Lund University and graduated in 1921. CTI (V o V) from 1921 to 1925. Employed at Kreuger & Tolls Construction AB from 1925 to 1932, involved in various engineering projects such as the construction of the Hammarforsens power plant, Årsta Bridge, Månsbo power plant, and the pumping station of the Östrand sulfuric acid factory. Employed at Slussbyggnadsaktiebolaget in Stockholm from 1932 to 1934, then at AB Fundament from 1934 to 1936, where he worked on the construction of the Storavan reservoir dam. Employed at Svensk Entreprenad AB from 1936 to 1940, working as a department engineer on the construction of Kegums power plant in Latvia. Employed at Krångede AB since 1944, primarily working on the construction of Krångede and Gammelänge power plants. Member of the Swedish Technical Association. Traveled to Poland, Czechoslovakia, Austria, Germany in 1938, and Norway in 1939. Hobbies include shooting and outdoor activities.
